page.title: 13FARMING
page.content: There is hardly a square kilometre within this D_BLCK which is not farmed in some way. It is the{primary {industry}of the area. All the farms are{arable farms,}few carry{stock}in any quantity. Those that do have their land bordering on to the river where there is lush grass. The stock consists of dairy cattle, beef cattle and pigs. The{crops}grown are cereals, mainly wheat and barley, sugar beet, rape, potatoes, peas, green beans, broad beans and onions. Most farms, even small concerns, are {highly mechanised}and are worked with only a few men. Many of the farms have buildings which date back to the 17th century, the time of the agricultural revolution. These are built of brick and flint, the local stone.
